gololang.concurrent.workers

Class Port

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.concurrent.workers.Port

  • public final class Port
extends java.lang.Object
    A port is the communication endpoint to a worker function.

    A port is obtained from a worker environment when spawning a function. It can then be used to send messages that will be eventually processed by the target function. Messages are being put in a first-in, first-out queue.

      • Port

        public Port(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor,
            WorkerFunction function)
        Port constructor.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public Port send(java.lang.Object message)
        Sends a message to the target worker function. This method returns immediately as message processing is asynchronous.
        Parameters:
        message - the message of any type.
        Returns:
        the same port object.
